page.title: 05Ecology Nature Reserve
page.content: There is a nature reserve situated around the Old Warden Tunnel Baulk and Cutting. The old Bedford to Hitchin railway line runs through the cutting and tunnel in the reserve. Most of the Baulk is covered with hawthorn and bramble scrub with patches of rosebay willowherb and thistles. This attracts many birds as a nesting and roosting site, including big flocks of redwings and field-fares in the winter. The ends of the baulk show the original rough grassland with cowslips and hairy violet in the spring. At the south end there are a few tall ashes and crab trees, much favoured by bull finches. A rich flora of cowslips, hairy violet, oxeye daisy, spiny restharrow, salad burnet, pepper-saxifrage, dwarf thistle and quaking-grass is to be found north of the tunnel mouth.
